sect1.title: What's Covered Here?

important.title: Prerequisites for this Guide
important.para: This section assumes you have completed the section: &susemgr; &productnumber3; Installation as an Extension

sect1.para: This chapter finalizes &susemgr; setup. You will perform the following procedures:

listitem.para: Use a terminal to initiate &susemgr; setup
Create the admin user with the &susemgr; WebGUI
Connect with &scc; and select channels appropriate for your clients media and software sources

note.title: Channels and Repositories
note.para: Before connecting your first client you will need to sync with &scc;. Syncing with &scc; provides your client systems with installation media, software and updates and are called Channels. Channels are always associated with a clients specific distribution, version and architecture. Once you have selected a repository from &scc;, &susemgr; will mirror the selected repository to your &susemgr; Server's /var/spacewalk/ directory.

procedure.title: &susemgr; Setup
procedure.para: This section will guide you through &susemgr; setup procedures.

step.para: To begin login to the &sle; 12 desktop. Open a terminal and as root and type: yast2 susemanager_setup then press enter to initiate setup.
On the initial screen select Set up SUSE Manager from scratch and then Next to continue.

Enter an email address which will receive notifications about the servers status. The number of emails sent from Manager can be extensive, therefore notifications via email may be disabled from the webGUI after setup if desired. Select Next to continue.

Enter your Certificate information and a password. The password should be stored in a secure location. Without this password it will not be possible to setup a &susemgr; Proxy Server. Select Next to proceed.
You will be using an Embedded Database for this guide. Enter a database user and password. This password should be stored in a secure location. Select Next to continue.
